data.headline: Nasdaq 100 futures drop 0.8–1.0% amid persistent concerns over AI-driven market disruption and competitive pressure from Alibaba’s Qwen 3.5.
bullets: Chip stocks, including Nvidia, underperform as the tech and Big Tech CapEx-driven selloff spreads to software, logistics, financials, and real estate.
S&P 500 futures fall about 0.4% and Dow futures 0.2–0.4%, extending back-to-back S&P weekly losses and a five-week Nasdaq losing streak.
Fiserv rises premarket after Jana Partners takes a stake, while Danaher declines on reports of a Masimo deal.
ZIM Integrated Shipping surges on Hapag-Lloyd merger speculation; Norwegian Cruise Line gains on Elliott Management stake.
Renewed Warner Bros. Discovery–Paramount merger talks and Blackstone’s pursuit of Champions Group boost media and private-equity M&A sentiment.
Traders face a thin immediate catalyst deck but anticipate a pivotal week of data, including Empire State manufacturing, NAHB housing, Fed minutes, jobs, Q4 GDP, and Friday’s PCE.
Earnings focus this week includes Walmart, DoorDash, Palo Alto Networks (after the bell), Medtronic, Energy Transfer, and Vulcan Materials.
